actions.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 218.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-962, by Mr. Derrick.

Mr. Derrick asked unanimous consent that the resolution be modified to extend the time for debate on the conference report accompanying H.R. 5835 to be extended from one hour to two hours. Agreed to without objection.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 5835 with 2 hours 0 of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. All points of order against the conference report and against its consideration are waived. The conference report shall be considered as read when called up for consideration. No further disposition of the bill shall be in order except pursuant to a subsequent order of the House.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 275 - 142 (Roll no. 527).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the conference report on the bill (H.R. 5835) to provide for reconciliation pursuant to section 4 of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 1991, and against its consideration.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on H.R. 5835 (budget reconciliation).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the conference report on the bill (H.R. 5835) to provide for reconciliation pursuant to section 4 of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 1991, and against its consideration.
